$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/plugin-macros.text:
\define wt(wikitext:"example") <$wikify name="in" text="""$wikitext$""" type="text/plain"> <$set name="out" value=""" $wikitext$ """> <$macrocall $name="renderWT" input=<> output=<>/> \end \define renderWT(input,output)
``` $input$ ```
$output$
\end \define revealstate(tiddler,stateID) <$set name="qualstate" value=<> > <$reveal type="nomatch" state=<> text="visible" animate="yes"> <$button set=<> setTo="visible" class="btnClosed">Show <$reveal type="match" state=<> text="visible" animate="yes"> <$button set=<> setTo="hidden" class="btnOpen">Hide section
<$transclude tiddler="$tiddler$" mode="block"/>
<$list filter="[{$tiddler$!!wmr-source-link}prefix[https://tiddlywiki.com]]"> More on tiddlywiki.com | <$link to="$tiddler$">Open separately
\end
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/plugin-macros.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/plugin-macros

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/styles/styles.cs.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/styles/styles.css

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/about.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/about
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/about.text:
Many examples of wikitext allow you to find simple solutions for common features quickly. Also great for testing. Mostly copied from or inspired by

* [[Tobi Beer’s Markup Reference|http://tobibeer.github.io/tb5/#Markup%20Reference]]
** try his [[searchable version|http://tobibeer.github.io/tb5/#Markup]] too!

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/code.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/code.text:
<> Use double backticks ... <> For longer code use a [[code block|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Code%20Blocks%20in%20WikiText]]: 
```
monospaced
codeblock
```
``` monospaced codeblock ```
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/code.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/code

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/filters.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/filters.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/filters
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/filters.text:
!!! Display the result of a filter expression

Use [[filter operators|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Filter%20Operators]] like `tag` to select tiddlers.

List tiddlers tagged `Foo`:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]] }}}
">>

List tiddlers tagged `Foo` OR `Bar`:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]][tag[Bar]] }}}
">>

List tiddlers tagged `Foo` AND `Bar`:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]] +[tag[Bar]] }}}
">>

List tiddlers tagged `Foo` NOT `Bar`:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]] -[tag[Bar]] }}}
">>

---

!!! Limit results

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]limit[1]] }}}
">>

---

!!! Sorting

Sort titles:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]][tag[Bar]] +[sort[]] }}}
">>

Sort reverse:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]][tag[Bar]] +[!sort[]] }}}
">>

Sort numbers:

<<wt "{{{ [[1]][[10]][[2]][[3]] +[nsort[]] }}}
">>

First created:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]][tag[Bar]] +[sort[created]] }}}
">>

Last modified:

<<wt "{{{ [tag[Foo]][tag[Bar]] +[!sort[modified]] }}}
">>

---

!!! Special effects

!!!! If empty ... aka Else ~

Since TW version 5.1.18

<<wt "{{{ [tag[foo]] ~[[no foo]] }}}
">>

!!!! Range

<<wt "{{{ [range[3,1,0.5]] }}}
">>

See https://tiddlywiki.com/#range%20Operator

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/font-variants.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/font-variants.text:
<<wt "Normal text: We don’t serve their kind here! What? Your droids. They’ll have to wait outside. We don’t want them here. Listen, why don’t you wait out by the speeder. We don’t want any trouble. I heartily agree with you sir. Negola dewaghi wooldugger?!? He doesn’t like you. I’m sorry.">>

<<wt "''bold'' ">>


<<wt //italics//>>


<<wt "''//bold italics//'' ">>


<<wt __underline__>>


<<wt ~~strikethrough~~>>


<<wt super^^script^^>>


<<wt sub,,script,,>>


<<wt "! Heading 1

!! Heading 2

!!! Heading 3

!!!! Heading 4

!!!!! Heading 5

!!!!!! Heading 6
">>
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/font-variants.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/font-variants

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/images.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/images.text:
!!! Internal images

Images saved in the wiki:

<<wt """[img width=128 [CircleJack.svg]]
[img width=64 [title/tooltip|CircleJack.svg]]
[img width=32 [CircleJack.svg]]
[img width=32 class="red" [CircleJack.svg]]
""">>


!!! Images from the web

<<wt """[img[https://tiddlywiki.com/favicon.ico]]
""">>


!!! Images in separate files

<<wt """[img[path/image.jpg]]
""">>

Solutions can be found in the user group ...
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/images.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/images

$:/AdvancedSearch

">>


<<wt "CamelCaseLink

~SuppressedLink
">>

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/lists.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/lists.text:
!! Wikitext lists !!! Unordered list <> !!! Ordered list <> !!! [[Definition list|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Definitions%20in%20WikiText]] <> --- !! [[List widget|https://tiddlywiki.com/prerelease/#ListWidget]] < """>> <> !!! List format ```
    <$list filter="[tag[Foo]sort[title]]">
  • <>
```
    <$list filter="[tag[Foo]sort[title]]">
  • <>
!!! Store list item in variable By default, the title of the list item is stored in the Current Tiddler variable: ``` <$list filter="[tag[Bar]]"> <> {{||$:/core/ui/ViewTemplate/tags}} ``` <$list filter="[tag[Bar]]"> <> {{||$:/core/ui/ViewTemplate/tags}} When we store the title in our own variable, the Current Tiddler remains unchanged. In the following example, the tags of the displaying tiddler will be shown: ``` <$list filter="[tag[Bar]]" variable="tiddler"> <> {{||$:/core/ui/ViewTemplate/tags}} ``` <$list filter="[tag[Bar]]" variable="tiddler"> <> {{||$:/core/ui/ViewTemplate/tags}} !!! Empty message ``` <$list filter="[tag[foo]limit[1]]" emptyMessage="No `foo` tagged tiddlers available."> `foo` tagged tiddlers exist ``` <$list filter="[tag[foo]limit[1]]" emptyMessage="No `foo` tagged tiddlers available."> `foo` tagged tiddlers exist ``` <$list filter="[tag[Foo]limit[1]]" emptyMessage="no `Foo` tagged tiddlers available"> `Foo` tagged tiddlers exist. ``` <$list filter="[tag[Foo]limit[1]]" emptyMessage="no `Foo` tagged tiddlers available"> `Foo` tagged tiddlers exist.
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/lists.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/lists

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/macros.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/macros.text:
``` \define run(foo:'bar') [[$foo$]] <> ```
» defines macro `run`
» with parameter `foo`
» whose value defaults to `bar`
» outputs a link to value of param:
  [[foo bar]]
``` \define test() I am $(x)$. \end <$set name="x" value="y of z"> <> ```
» defines macro test which
» outputs value of variable x

» sets variable x to: "y
  of z" //(multiline allowed)//
» runs macro test which outputs:
  "I am y of z."
``` \define test(x, y, z:'0') $x$ $y$ $z$ \end <$macrocall $name="test" x=<> y={{!!title}}/> ```
» defines macro test
» outputs 3 params

» calls test via macrocall widget
» using macro version as param x
» and transclusion as param y

» output: <> {{!!title}} 0
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/macros.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/macros

``` """ tripple quotes to force hard linebreaks like this. """ ```
""" tripple quotes to force hard linebreaks like this. """ < as well as
are accepted ">> Both result in a `
` when rendered.

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/special-chars.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/special-chars.text:
<<wt "Dashes come in two sizes---the longer is the em dash (HTML: —).

The en dash (HTML: –) is for ranges (2000--2018) and connections (London--New York) 
">>

<<wt "---
horizontal rules: line with `---` only or HTML:
<hr>
">>


<<wt "2 × 5 m = 10 m

æ – å – œ – ø –  Æ – Å – Œ – Ø
">>

<<wt "* a non breaking space: entity
* a narrow no-break space: (no entity available)
* a en space: entity
* a em space: entity
* a 3-per-em space: entity
* a 4-per-em space: entity
* a 6-per-em space: (no entity available)
* a figure space entity
* a punctuation space: entity
* a thin space: entity
* a hair space: entity
">>

[[More Unicode characters and HTML entities|https://www.key-shortcut.com/en/character-tables/unicode-2000-2fff/]]
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/special-chars.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/special-chars

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/styles.text:
<<wt "!.red CSS
#.red classes can be
;.red assigned
:.red like
>.red this
">>


<<wt "@@.myClass.red
assign classes using double @
@@
">>


<<wt "@@color:darkorange; apply styles directly @@
">>


<<wt "@@.red
@@border:1px solid blue;
combine classes and styles 
@@
">>


<<wt "@@.purple Use style tags. @@ – Is it purple?

<style>
.purple{color:purple;}
</style>
">>

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/tabs.creator: Thomas Elmiger
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/tabs.text:
!!! Filter tiddlers for tabs

<$macrocall $name="wt" wikitext="""<<tabs "[tag[Foo]][tag[Bar]]" default:"$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/foo">>"""/>



!!! Vertical tabs

<$macrocall $name="wt" wikitext="""<<tabs "[tag[Foo]][tag[Bar]]" "$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/foo" class:"tc-vertical">>"""/>
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/tabs.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/tabs

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/templates.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/templates.text:
[[Transclude|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Transclusion%20in%20WikiText]] tiddler `.../foo` applying [[template|https://tiddlywiki.com/#TemplateTiddlers]] `.../tmpl-code`: <> Use template `Bar` for the [[Current Tiddler|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Current%20Tiddler]] (default):
``` {{||Bar}} ```
--- A template can show different fields of a tiddler. While the list of tiddlers tagged `Foo` shows the content of the field `title` ... <> ... the same for tag `Bar` displayed through the template $:/core/ui/ViewTemplate/subtitle shows the content of the fields `modifier` and `modified`: <>
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/templates.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/templates

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/transclusion.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/transclusion.text:
!!! Display content from other tiddlers Transclude [[text|$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/foo]] and [[images|$:/core/images/home-button]] from the main content (text field): <> <> !!! Content of tiddler fields
``` {{Foo!!bar}} {{!!bar}} ```
* field `bar` of tiddler `Foo` * field `bar` of the Current Tiddler !!! Data tiddler entries
``` {{Foo##index}} {{##index}} ```
* `index` of [[datatiddler|https://tiddlywiki.com/#DataTiddlers]] titled `Foo` * `index` of `CurrentTiddler` --- !!! Transclude widget Try the [[transclude widget|https://tiddlywiki.com/#TranscludeWidget]] if you have to set the parsing mode manually. <'>> <'>>
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/transclusion.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/transclusion

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/typed-elements.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/typed-elements.text:
``` $$$text/unknown plain text, not //formatted// $$$ ```
$$$text/unknown plain text, not //formatted// $$$
These are [[Typed Blocks|https://tiddlywiki.com/#Typed%20Blocks%20in%20WikiText]]
``` $$$image/svg+xml $$$ ```
$$$image/svg+xml $$$
``` $$$.svg $$$ ```
$$$.svg $$$
``` $$$text/vnd.tiddlywiki>text/html This is ''some'' wikitext $$$ ```
$$$text/vnd.tiddlywiki>text/html This is ''some'' wikitext $$$
``` $$$text/vnd.tiddlywiki>text/plain This is ''some'' wikitext $$$ ```
$$$text/vnd.tiddlywiki>text/plain This is ''some'' wikitext $$$
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/typed-elements.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/typed-elements

$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/variables.creator: Thomas
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/variables.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/variables
$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/variables.text:
\define animal1() lion \define animals1() seal
penguin \end !!! Set the value of a variable To use a local variable in a single tiddler, insert a definition at the very top of the tiddler: `\define animal1() lion` To use a variable in a limited part of a tiddler, use the [[set widget|https://tiddlywiki.com/#SetWidget]]: <$macrocall $name="wt" wikitext="""<$set name="animal2" value="zebra"> <> eats <> """/> !!! Multi-line variables ``` \define animals1() seal
penguin \end <> ``` <> <$macrocall $name="wt" wikitext="""<$set name="animals2" value=" * zebra * gnu * antelope "> <> """/> !!! Variables as parameters <$tiddler tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/foo"> <$macrocall $name="wt" wikitext="""<$set name="mywidth" value={{!!wmr-example}}> [img width=<> [CircleJack.svg]] """/> !!!! Change the value <$macrocall $name="wt" wikitext="""<$edit-text tiddler="$:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/foo" field="wmr-example"/> """/> Hint: We also use the [[tiddler widget|https://tiddlywiki.com/#TiddlerWidget]] above to set $:/plugins/telmiger/WMR/foo as the current tiddler in the context of the image. This makes sure that the [[text reference|https://tiddlywiki.com/#TextReference]] `!!wmr-example` points to the right field. The edit text widget should ''not'' be used to edit a field of the tiddler that contains it to ommit unwanted side effects.

$:/plugins/telmiger/support.text:
!! Support the Author ''Hi!'' I’m Thomas, the author of [[tid.li/tw5/plugins.html|https://tid.li/tw5/plugins.html]]. Feedback is always welcome, as well as funding for maintenance, support and new projects :) --- !!! One Time Support If using my plugins just makes you happy, consider a one time payment via ~PayPal to reward the effort: https://www.paypal.me/telmiger --- !!! Permanent Support If my tools make you more productive or save you time in your job or your everyday life, you can support me as a Patron: https://www.patreon.com/telmiger --- !!! Thank You Substantial parts of my availabe time go to the deveopment of useful plugins for [[TiddlyWiki|https://tiddlywiki.com/]]. – Many others do the same and I would like to thank them all, especially [[Jeremy Ruston|https://tiddlywiki.com/#JeremyRuston]] and all the active members of the community! //Hereby I promise to share future revenues (if any) with other developers who’s works I use or who inspired me.// If you like my work, I would be very happy to hear from you. ''Thank you very much for your support!''
//Thomas// https://thomas-elmiger.ch
$:/plugins/telmiger/support.title: $:/plugins/telmiger/support
$:/plugins/telmiger/support.creator: Thomas Elmiger
